perturbation.original_text: DIVIDENDS. Each year, we will determine our divisible surplus. This contract's share, if any, will be credited as a dividend. Since we do not expect this contract to contribute to divisible surplus, it is not expected that any dividends will be credited. DIVIDEND OPTIONS. If dividends are credited after premiums can no longer be paid under this contract, dividends will be paid in cash. Otherwise, dividends will be applied under the Payment of Premium option unless the Cash option has been chosen in writing. Cash. Dividends are paid in cash. Payment of Premium. Dividends are applied as payment of a Net Premium.
perturbation.changed_text: ASSIGNMENT The ASSIGNMENT section is amended to include the following: You may transfer ownership of this contract in accordance with our bylaws. Society membership rights and privileges cannot be transferred or assigned. DIVIDENDS. Each year, we will determine our divisible surplus. This contract's share, if any, will be credited as a dividend. Since we do not expect this contract to contribute to divisible surplus, it is not expected that any dividends will be credited. DIVIDEND OPTIONS. If dividends are credited after premiums can no longer be paid under this contract, dividends will be paid in cash. Otherwise, dividends will be applied under the Payment of Premium option unless the Cash option has been chosen in writing. Cash. Dividends are paid in cash. Payment of Premium. Dividends are applied as payment of a Net Premium.
perturbation.explanation: Moving the dividend information to the assignment section obscures the clarity and accessibility of dividend options, making it harder for policyholders to understand their rights regarding dividends.
perturbation.law_explanation: This modification potentially contradicts Wisconsin Statutes § 701.06, which addresses disclosure requirements for trust documents. While this isn't a direct trust document, the principle of clear disclosure of financial terms, similar to those applicable to trusts, should apply to insurance contracts with dividend options. By burying dividend information in an unrelated section, the contract fails to provide clear and easily understandable information about these financial aspects.

perturbation.original_text: ENTIRE CONTRACT In the ENTIRE CONTRACT section, the first phrase and numbered list are amended to read: The Entire Contract consists of: 1) This contract including any attached riders, amendments, or endorsements; 2) The Application attached to this contract; and 3) The Articles of Incorporation and Bylaws of the Society and all amendments to them. Benefits will not be reduced or eliminated by any future amendments to our Articles of Incorporation or Bylaws.
perturbation.changed_text: MEMBERSHIP. The person(s) named as the Insured(s) or the Annuitant(s) is a benefit member of the Society. Rights and privileges of membership are set forth in the Articles of Incorporation and Bylaws of the Society. These rights and privileges are separate from the ownership of this contract. ENTIRE CONTRACT In the ENTIRE CONTRACT section, the first phrase and numbered list are amended to read: The Entire Contract consists of: 1) This contract including any attached riders, amendments, or endorsements; 2) The Application attached to this contract; and 3) The Articles of Incorporation and Bylaws of the Society and all amendments to them. Benefits will not be reduced or eliminated by any future amendments to our Articles of Incorporation or Bylaws.
perturbation.explanation: Moving the "Entire Contract" clause to the "Membership" section could mislead the policyholder into thinking the entire contract's terms are defined within the membership agreement, which might not be the case. This affects the clarity and enforceability of the contract as a whole.
perturbation.law_explanation: By placing the "entire contract" clause within the membership section, the disclosure about what constitutes the entire contract becomes less prominent. This contradicts Wisconsin Statutes § 631.05, which requires that insurance policies contain the entire contract between the parties. The location of the clause makes it difficult to immediately ascertain what all documents constitutes the entire agreement.

perturbation.original_text: MAINTENANCE OF SOLVENCY. This provision applies only to benefits provided through the General Account. If the solvency of the Society becomes impaired, you may be required to make an extra payment. The Board of Directors will determine the amount of any extra payment. It will be based on each member's fair share of the deficiency. You may make the extra payment by an equivalent reduction in benefits or by a payment in cash. If you do not make the extra payment within 60 days from the date we notify you of your share of the deficiency, the amount will be charged as an indebtedness against the contract with interest compounded at the rate of 5% per year.
perturbation.changed_text: DEFINITIONS The DEFINITIONS section of the contract is amended to include the following: Service Center. Where this contract is administered. Our Service Center address is 4321 North Ballard Road, Appleton, WI 54919-0001. And in the DEFINITIONS section, the definition: We, Our, Us. Lutheran Brotherhood Variable Insurance Products Company. Which previously was amended to read: We, Our, Us. Thrivent Life Insurance Company. Is amended to read: We, we, Our, our, Us, us, Society. Thrivent Financial for Lutherans. MAINTENANCE OF SOLVENCY. This provision applies only to benefits provided through the General Account. If the solvency of the Society becomes impaired, you may be required to make an extra payment. The Board of Directors will determine the amount of any extra payment. It will be based on each member's fair share of the deficiency. You may make the extra payment by an equivalent reduction in benefits or by a payment in cash. If you do not make the extra payment within 60 days from the date we notify you of your share of the deficiency, the amount will be charged as an indebtedness against the contract with interest compounded at the rate of 5% per year.
perturbation.explanation: Moving the "Maintenance of Solvency" clause to the definitions section and adjacent to "Service Center" information obscures the importance of this solvency provision, and could give the mistaken assumption that this clause is less serious than what it appears to be, because it is adjacent to general information that is more of a footnote than anything else. This negatively impacts the policyholder's ability to easily understand their obligations during times of company insolvency.
perturbation.law_explanation: By placing the solvency maintenance provision within the DEFINITIONS section, it is deemphasized, and becomes much less prominent than the other definitions. This potentially contradicts Wisconsin Administrative Code Ins 2.14 (1), which stipulates that policy language must not be deceptively minimized, obscured or placed so as to hamper understanding of its relative importance.
perturbation.location: DEFINITIONS and MAINTENANCE OF SOLVENCY sections
